moves.6. exd5: I would have taken with the bishop.
moves.8... Bxf3 9. Bxd8 Bxg2 10. Bxc7 Bxh1: And he ends up down by three points. Now to just trade off the remaining material.
moves.11. Bb5+ Ke7: I still have to be careful though, his pieces are swarming around me and that pawn looks dangerous.
moves.12. d6+ Ke6 13. Bc4+ Kd7 14. Bxf7: ? I wouldn't have done this, it loses his passed pawn.
moves.14... Bxd6 15. Bxd6 Kxd6: And my king is much more centralized for the endgame. This is a very interesting endgame, we both still have a knight undeveloped and it's only move 15. Some people might say it's still the middlegame, but I think it's the endgame.
moves.18. O-O-O: Probably good as it gets his rook ready.
I wouldn't have done that, he should centralize.
moves.33. Kc1 Rda2 34. Kb1 Reg2: Trying to make his knight leave from the defense of the h pawn.
moves.40. Kc1: ?? I suppose this was his way of resigning.
moves.40... Rxb7 41. h3 Rg2 42. h4 Rf7 43. Kd1: Good game guysterbro, I had fun.
